title: Tim Pawlenty
summary: Timothy James Pawlenty (/pəˈlɛnti/;[1] born November 27, 1960) is an American attorney, businessman, and politician. A Republican, he served as the 39th governor of Minnesota from 2003 to 2011. From 1993 to 2003, he served in the Minnesota House of Representatives, where he was majority leader for two terms. In 2011, he ran for the Republican presidential nomination and was subsequently a leading contender to be Mitt Romney's running mate before serving as co-chair of Romney's campaign.
